basics.name: Jamie Johnstone
basics.label: Cloud Engineer
basics.summary: Exceedingly hands-on, happy to get stuck in, and eager to contribute to team success through learning and collaborating with others to continuously improve and deliver secure and reliable products and services.

projects.name: jamiejohnstone.com - my devops tooling playground
projects.description: While jamiejohnstone.com looks like the simplest website in the world, I consider it a bit of a playground for experimenting with automated deployment pipelines. Behind the scenes, this simple one-page site has been delivered with Terraform and CloudFormation, Jenkins, CircleCI and Github Actions, as a simple S3 Bucket Website and via a highly-available Kubernetes/Docker cluster.

projects.name: Tixy - an open event ticketing platform
projects.description:
Tixy was a leading-edge even ticketing platform designed to satisfy the growing needs of New Zealand's community arts sector including individual promoters, medium-sized venues and larger scale producing companies.

This project was a massive learning experience for myself and the team I worked with. From my role, I forged relationships, lead user research, feature specification and design, and contributed code (mostly in PHP, SQL and Perl) along with managing a small team of developers.

work.summary:
• Managed product in the B2B-focused validation engineering team, looking after embedded validators  used by over 75 public transport agencies and millions of commuters worldwide.
• Worked with internal and external stakeholders to understand requirements, prioritise work streams, drive development and deliver on schedule.
• In-depth data analysis and dashboard creation with Kibana, Tableau and SQL.
• Actively participated in organisation delivery model transformation programmes.

• Managed event IT and field operations for events up to 80,000 attendees for New Zealand's largest kiwi-owned ticketing company.
• Worked closely with engineers to ensure smooth operation and development of Azure-hosted platform.
• Provided training and support for staff and clients, including liaising with external IT teams to ensure successful deployment of ticketing systems and regular releasing/maintenance.
• Oversaw IT operations including purchasing, configuring and maintaining equipment, networking and software/services.
• Managed long-term projects and developed strategies to meet client or business requirements.
• Recruited, trained and managed casual staff to assist with the delivery of event services.
• Regularly wrote scripts and tools to automate tasks and improve team efficiency.

work.location: Auckland, New Zealand / London, United Kingdom
work.summary:
• Freelance Stage Manager for large-scale live events with up to 30,000 attendees.
• Consistently improved team process and efficiency to deliver amazing experiences.
• Recent work included Disney's Aladdin (West End) and World Master's Games Opening Ceremony 2017 (Auckland).
highlights: 2018 - Assistant Stage Manager, Disney's Aladdin (West End) - London, UK
2018 - Stage Manager (Assembly Main Hall), Edinburgh Fringe Festival - Edinburgh, UK
2017 - Deputy Stage Manager, World Master's Games Opening Ceremony - Auckland, NZ
